author: sarah lane
text: Takes FOREVER to load. I wanted something to make lists and notes and use on the PC without an Android environment. This would be good except I think all the super fancy other stuff makes it top heavy. Trying to write a simple note it just sits there taking forever to load. And I have the newest Samsung phone with a super WIFI connection.

author: Makayla Wageman (MK)
text: I was looking for goal management software for entirely personal use and while maybe not initially intended for someone like me, this is PERFECT for what I needed! It took me a moment to realize how customizable everything was, yet also really intuitive and I didn't have to look anything up or seek any tutorial. If you're seeking anything like that for yourself I cant recommend this app/site enough. If the free version is not enough for your needs (unlikely) you only need to pay $7 a month

author: Erin Bailey
text: The notifications are still an issue, though the all notifications just saying "ClickBot" issue has been resolved. I do not want clickup to use the convo section, but I can only mark each task as "not a convo" which is only helpful if it's a repeating task. Also, because it's in the convo section the only quick action available is to reply with "ok" - I need to be able to snooze or mark done or anything that might actually help me manage my time.

author: Matt Kendrick
text: What is going on with this mobile app - you guys have made it impossible to match up to an already existing clickup account. I signed up on my PC first, then downloaded the app to my phone. Once the app is open there is no login option; only a button that sends an email to me, and everytime I click that one and only option I get a message that there was a "problem with email" and nothing happens. Why not just let existing users login, link their devices and move on?
developer_response_text:
Hey Matthew! Thanks for the feedback!

We're sorry you encountered this issue. If there isn't a "Other Sign On Options' button available at the bottom of the login page after entering your email (a password option will replace the email link verification), please contact us at help@clikckup.com so we can look into this further & find a resolution.

author: AJ Rhoads
text: I spent the day looking for an app that I can use for free (until I can afford to pay a subscription) that allows me to invite people and share tasks that need done. This app made that very simple with everything I want; task descriptions, subtask, comments, assigning, and much more. I can also access this from my phone, computer(s), and even my Chromebook. I recommend using this instead of waiting for Microsoft to reset a phone number in 30 days.
developer_response_text: Hey AJ! Thanks so much for the review. We really appreciate the feedback! üôå We're so glad to hear that the app has everything you want. That's music to our ears!üé∂ If there ever is anything at all we can do to improve your experience with the app in the future, please let us know at help@clickup.com. Our team is available anytime to help!‚ú®

author: Ben
text: I was hoping this would be an Evernote replacement but there are no options to highlight text. I need multicolor highlighting options. Also, you cannot change the color of the text. These seem like very basic features but they are not available with this app. Otherwise, it seems very good and it might work for you, definitely worth trying. Unfortunately for me, my search continues.

author: Kelempiau Kelasi
text: 1 year later, same problem: ADD OFFLINE FUNCTIONALITY!! I go to jot down a quick task and I can't because without signal you can't select the list to put it in! Or anything else! This app is useless without a speedy internet connection. Even a completely separate "offline" folder that I can use without signal to add and remember things to sort later would be more useful than this brick of junk. And I pay for the web version. It's good. But this mobile app is embarrassing.
developer_response_text: Hey there! Thanks so much for the feedback! üôå We're definitely working on improving our mobile apps & eventually they'll have near feature parity as our website. In the meantime, please contact us at help@clickup.com so we can help you with our Offline Mode feature. Our Support team is available anytime to help!‚ú®.

author: Jason Q
text: I have used ClickUp for over 1 year. The Clickup desktop experience has been great. Unfortunately, the mobile app is much less so, and is still far from feature parity with the desktop app. For example, ClickUp Desktop has had the LineUp feature for over 2 years now. I use it to highlight my most important tasks. However, the mobile app STILL DOESN'T HAVE IT! It's extremely disappointing to see basic features like LineUp missing from the mobile application.
developer_response_text: Hey Jason! Thanks so much for the feedback! ‚ú® We're definitely working on improving our mobile apps & eventually they'll have near feature parity as our website. Keep track of what's coming next on our mobile roadmap. In the meantime, you can log into ClickUp from the web browser on your mobile device to use/access the LineUp feature. üåª

author: Cecil Williams
text: ClickUp on desktop is, hands down, the best productivity product I've ever used. Even tho it's designed for businesses, it is just as useful for personal use. I've used ClickUp for over a year to manage my personal tasks/goals, my household, and my university classes/career. The reason this isn't 5 stars is because the mobile app is just not as good. I've used the Apple and Android versions, the old app and the newer one. There is a lot of things you can't do on the app, it will frustrate you.
developer_response_text: Hey, Cecil! Thank you so much for your review! üòä We're so glad to hear you're using ClickUp for your own to-do lists! Sorry to hear you're frustrated, but we're constantly working on improving the mobile app, and we know we will with user's feedback like yours! üöÄ

author: April Melchior
text: I really love the desktop app, but the Android app is buggy and isn't adding all scheduled task to the calendars and "next up" or "tomorrow" tabs. Also, the widget is completely useless. I was hoping the widget would have a few options including a calendar, but it's just a list of "today" tasks so you can't even see what you have coming up the following day.
developer_response_text:
Hey April! Thanks so much for your feedback!

We're so glad that you love the desktop app! That's music to our ears!

Please email us at help@clickup.com so we can look into the issues you ran into and offer suggestions that may improve your mobile experience! Our Support team is available 24/7 to help!

author: Brenna Wiley
text: I absolutely love ClickUp. I use it to organize home projects as well as school stuff, and the level of organization and the amount of features in it is insane (and kind of overwhelming for a few hours until you start figuring it out). I definitely recommend using it (and make sure to use the desktop version as well, especially when setting things up).
developer_response_text: Hey, Brenna! Thanks for the fantastic review! We're so happy to hear that ClickUp is keeping you organized and on track! üèÇ

author: A Google user
text: To be clear, ClickUp is one of the best task management apps out there and their web version is outstanding, but as others have stated, the mobile version is lacking. Time view is limited, going through each list is slow and a pain. There is a new version coming with ClickUp 2.0 and with the way they have been releasing features in the last year, I'm hopeful it will be great.

author: S A
text: I can't find anything assigned to me, nor will it show my favorites on the favorite list, nor can I find anything, period. I can use the search feature but I have to know the exact name of the document to find it, & my "dashboards" have never been in the dashboard section, nor do I know how to find them, although they are sent weekly. This app is nothing but stress. It has the potential to be great, but perhaps not the ability.

author: Aiesha
text: Edit: 2nd time thing Android app, tried before in April 2021 and there's supposedly been bug fixes and improvements since then. But for me, still useless. I can't even add a task! Forces me to choose a list and there's literally nothing there for me to select, so I end up being unable to add a task. The "roadmap", which I presume is there to help navigate through the mobile app, leads to a "nothing here" page. Ridiculous. Uninstalling AGAIN.
developer_response_text:
Hey Aiesha! Thank you for the review! We really appreciate your feedback!

We really want to help! Please email us at help@clickup.com so we can show you how to add a task on the mobile app and offer suggestions that may improve your mobile experience! Our Customer Support team is available 241/7 to assist you!

author: Scott Tilton
text: Not Useable at all. Love the web app, but the app on my phone I can't use. The first day I used it, got logged in, no problems. Next day and since can't even open the app. The clickup logo shows on the screen, and that is all she wrote. Just sits there forever. I have tried rebooting phone, forcing the app closed. Nothing works. Guess will have to stick with just the web app.
developer_response_text: Hey, Scott! We were notified that Google recently made an update to Android phones that caused some issues with apps using webview! This has recently been fixed by Google. Can you please make sure that you have updated Chrome and the Android system webview to the latest versions on your phone? Let us know if this helps resolve the issue!

author: jo jo
text: ClickUp is a great tool, but the app is not so great. The features on the app are limited, and there is only one widget, which stopped functioning correctly. For my android it no longer recognizes what app to associate with it, so when I click to open either a task or reminder android gives me a list of apps to open the link with, and ClickUp isn't one of them :(

author: Tomas Catz
text: As new versions have come out, the mobile app has gotten farther and farther from the desktop and web app experience. Many features I use regularly such as subtasks and manual sort order to indicate priorities have gotten harder or impossible to use on mobile. At this point, I pretty much just use this app to stub out tasks in the backlog and have to use a desktop for everything else. Not the end of the world, but not nearly as useful to me.
developer_response_text: Hey Tomas! Thanks so much for the feedback! ü§ó We're actively working on improving the mobile apps and eventually they'll have near feature parity as our web app. In the meantime, you can access ClickUp from your mobile device's web browser so that you can use the features the way you'd like.üì±

author: Cato Keito
text: The app has much more limited functionality than the browser version, and it's a bit disappointing that I can't reorder subtasks or create recurring due dates, but it's good enough. I'm posting because I don't see how to contact support through the app to report the issue with Docs. The behavior of the Docs feature is so poor, it's basically not useable for anything other than typing paragraphs. If I use enter, heading, paste, undo, or otherwise try to edit my text, text moves or disappears. üòï
developer_response_text: Hey, Keito! Thanks for the review! Eventually, the new app will have near feature parity with our web app, but with all the dynamic features we've built it will take time. Be sure to checkout our mobile roadmap for more information. Also, can you send us an email to help@clickup.com for your issue with Docs? We'd love to look into this!üïµüèª‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è

author: Andrew Hansen
text: EDIT: ClickUp has offline mode now for all platforms, and it also saves all tasks in the task tray (in desktop mode) offline. I emailed their support team and was very impressed with their fast and helpful response! The mobile app is still missing some important features, but this new update adds a lot more. It's also an excellent companion to the full-featured desktop version on the web. It's great for adding tasks and reminders on the go.
developer_response_text: Hey, Andie! Thanks so much for the updated review! We're so glad that you were impressed with our support team & that they we're able to help! üòä The mobile app will continue to be refined. Our goal in the next year is to develop the app with the same capabilities as our web app. You can keep track of what's coming next on our mobile roadmap!üöÄ

author: Tom Haight
text: It's feature rich and looks nice on screen, but it leaves a lot to be desired behind the screens and has useless support. The person I talked to knew less than me about the product, and the issue is STILL unresolved. Also, the import from Notion is not worth the effort. Of 49 Notion entities, not a single one was usable after import. They were a mess, and they weren't even complicated. I won't be using the product at all. It doesn't seem worth the time to get proficient using it.

author: Jonathan Noorman
text: The program is great on PC but the app lacks some things. You cannot look at forms or docs in the app. You also cannot enter addresses which is crazy. You cannot set a default startup page. The calendar view very often doesn't load or like right now, shows nothing. I use it for my main calendar and this is frustrating. It also desperately needs to have a caching ability to load the latest data and keep it in memory for offline use. Useless app without cell service.
developer_response_text:
Hey Jonathan! Thanks for the review!

We're definitely working on improving our mobile app & eventually it'll have near feature parity as our web app. In the meantime, please contact us at help@clickup.com so we can look into the loading issues you ran into and so we can offer suggestions that may improve your mobile experience.

author: Osmond K
text: Overall it is a good app. However, I keep turning on column on the Gantt view and they stubbornly keep disappearing. Worst of all "Reschedule dependencies" almost always turns itself off. I have many Gantt's and before I do anything, I have to add columns and turn on reschedule dependencies. What a nightmare... I am getting to be fed up with this. I reached out to help a couple of days ago, so far nobody has gotten back...
developer_response_text: Hey Osmond! Thanks for letting us know! üí´ We truly apologize for any inconvenience this issue & our delayed response has caused. We've recently had a higher than usual influx of customer inquiries, which has temporarily slowed down our response time. However, we're eager to get to look into this issue & find a resolution. ‚ú®

author: Daryl Allison
text: ClickUp is incredibly feature rich. The mobile app is extremely packed to allow this robust tool work on your phone. Do not begin your ClickUp journey here. Get onto your desktop, watch some videos, learn the tool there, then discover how to make the mobile version extend your use of the tool. I'm a power user on the desktop. The mobile app is still surprisingly flawed, including its bug reporting function. I highly recommend the desktop version, but for now beware on mobile.
developer_response_text: Hey Daryl! Thank you for the feedback!üåª We're definitely working on improving our mobile apps & eventually they'll have near feature parity as our website. Keep track of what's coming next on our mobile roadmap. In the meantime, logging into ClickUp from the web browser on your mobile device may improve your mobile experience. üí´

author: Ruth
text: The app is terrible. The interface is not clean or organized. I tried to use one of their templates and you can't use it on the app, you have to log in to the browser. So I did & it kept downloading the wrong template. Finally I found another one I liked but it would not let me edit it. If you just want to be organized for your personal life, notion's app has a nicer interface and better templates.

author: Hannah Kennedy
text: I tried to sign up on the website but it "took too long to respond" so I tried signing up on the app. After typing in my email multiple times, I finally got an email. After clicking the link and filling out my information, the submit button would not work. I closed the app and went through everything again but when I hit submit, it came up with an error. I clicked the button again and it said password already exists. If that means my account was created, it won't let me log in anywhere.
developer_response_text: Hey Hannah! Thank you very much for the feedback! üôå We're sorry to hear that you experienced that issue. Please contact us at help@clickup.com so we can look into that issue and find a resolution. Our Support team is available around the clock to help!‚ú®

author: jthomas kay
text: This could be a great app, but it's not. I have only one of my Spaces available to me at the moment. Tried to reinstall. Did not work. I can only access via my favorites. -Can't drag and drop subtasks. -Overdue does not work in mobile, so it is tough to know what tasks are actually Overdue, at least with the function that is supposed to tell you. Instead, we see random dates, not in order by date.
developer_response_text: Hey there! Thanks for taking the time to leave your feedback! ‚ú® The new app was released with a limited set of core features to get them into your hands faster & eventually it'll have near feature parity with our web app!üì± In the meantime, please email us at help@clickup.com so we share a couple options that may improve your mobile experience.ü§ó

author: Nathan Essex
text: I love the web app but mobile is buggy. Sometimes I can't open folders, other times I can't create tasks. Updates from the web can take a while to sync and I don't really like how the calendar looks. I want to make tasks and take notes on the fly so I don't have to use multiple apps and avoid double dictation. But the app really just acts like a fancy to do list where I can check things off and not much else reliably.

author: Gorboduc
text: After the most OBNOXIOUS onboarding experience of Gestapo-like marketing interrogation - during which I lied about every question because it didn't allow me to tell the truth - the app ballooned to over 75 megs in under five minutes, and I still hadn't entered a single task. This is because all I got was 10 min of pulsating purple circles indicating that something, I know not what, was downloading at glacial speed. Tried the web interface but on a phone it's unreadable. Prompt unsubscribe.
developer_response_text: Hey, there! Oh on! We're sorry to hear you're having trouble with our new mobile app! We'd love to learn more about what you're experiencing with the speed and curious to see what you mean by the onboarding section! Could you please write to help@clickup.com with some screenshots or video recordings? This would be super helpful!

author: Jermey Matthews
text: The way I felt about Gmail in 2003 is the way I feel about ClickUp now. They might very well change the game. However, they might very well be Springpad, which had more and better features than Evernote, but we all know who won. The ClickUp Android app is a joke. The web app is great; make people use that until you can get this one right.
developer_response_text: Hey, there! We really appreciate the time you've taken to share your experience with us! We'd love to chat with you further! Could you please write to product@clickup.com? We'd love to set up an interview! We look forward to hearing from you! üòÑ

author: Leah Oliver
text: I love ClickUp. It's been working great for me for at least 5 months. The Android app is usually fine. Currently sharing something to the app to create at tZk isn't available, something with the latest update I guess. One thing I'd like to see is the ability to copy the email address for a list or task so I can send updates and tasks that way.
developer_response_text:
Hey Leah! Thanks for the review!

We're so glad to hear that you love ClickUp & we really want to help with the task creating problem you encountered. Please contact us at help@clickup.com so we can look into that & try to find a resolution. Feel free to add any suggestions to our feedback boards, that's the best way for your idea to be considered!

author: Content by LB
text: The app is horrible. The new updates are horrible. You can't see who assigns tasks anymore it just says "User assigned" "user commented". When you're in the app you can't tag anyone specific in the comments. I'll go in the following day and see I've missed 20 tasks that were due yesterday when none of them were showing up yesterday.

author: KYLER HOLLAND
text: Completely disappointed. I LOVED everything about ClickUp. Now, using it full time with work as well as personal and there is NO LANDSCAPE MODE for Android or tablets. This is such a simple ask that has been a feature request for 3 YEARS! I'm beyond frustrated. Unable to actually use tablets as intended. How do we mainly use clickup on the computer? LANDSCAPE. Please update to allow support for Android.

author: Mike Shick
text: This app is horrid. For any reasonable access to info inserted using desktop app, it's simply unusable and content cannot be accessed. For instance, if I want to search for comments in my project or tasks, I cannot. I put valuable project data in there and need access in the field on my mobile device. We'll, just use the web version then, albeit very difficult to manage on a phone, but the app will not let you see use the web app. The installed app steels the effort. So basically, it stinks.
developer_response_text: Hey Mike! Thanks for the feedback! üôå Please contact us at help@clickup.com so we can find a resolution for the issues you encountered and offer suggestions that may improve your experience. Our Support team is available anytime to help!‚ú®

author: Brandon Bosco
text: Please, im begging you, just fix the add task widget. It has been on and off broken for YEARS. Right now it spawns 2-3 duplicate "add task" trays, none of which are defaulted to my last used list. Then once I get the extra trays closed and the correct list selected, it fails to save the task anyway. All I want is to press a button and be able to create a task in the same list every time. That's it. I don't get why this is still an issue.

author: Rahshel Brown
text: They keep updating the app and somehow it keeps getting worse. I just need to see my tasks in order of due date, now that doesn't even work well. How is it showing me tasks due in October before tasks due in September, and all of that shown before tasks still due in August?! This is very simple, stop making it hard. Update: and it just keeps getting worse üôÉ I'm just going to look for a new app at this point

author: S Soltani
text: App login doesn't work when MFA is on. I wonder if they have ever tested their app! It asks you to enter your email and password, and then it asks you to enter the Authentication code. You switch to the Authenticator app to see the code and you switch back to ClickUp to enter the code. It will then close the browser and go back to ClickUp, but then nothing happens and it shows you the login page again.

author: Vic Brown
text: ClickUp works really well on my PC but when I go to add a task on my to-do list from the ClickUp mobile app, a pop up says "status missing" and will not let me save the task. There does not appear to be an option to "add the required status". I am using Samsung Galaxy S24+. Please can you fix this bug?

author: Jovana Kizovska
text: - customer support 0 - app keeps rearranging my fields in the tasks, also 0 - automation emails now share my location without permission, also 0 - im forced to use it cause of my employer, otherwise 0/10 - it used to be an amazing application up until last year, its sad and disappointing. edit: i contacted CS, no help at all, i keep telling them i have sensitive info and they keep asking for screenshots/screen recordings. dissapointed.

author: Charlie Morton
text: I'm grateful for Clickup but am also always amazed at how convoluted the interface is! It needs to be much simpler how to find your tasks quickly. Even in 'Recents' - assignments I've been given simply don't show up. Please make the design simpler for us to find our own tasks quickly and easily. Thank you.

author: Mola Diver
text: So far this app is pretty useless. Tickets, threads and other screens always show up empty, also when I open from a notification. *** Fast forward one year. still doesn't work and I can't change my password inside the app from a change password link in my email because I get a big red API error message. Uninstalled for the 4th time now.

author: Patt Angels
text: It's terrible. I downloaded the app to help me work on my personal goals, but it's unintuitive, and I've never managed to create a single goal. The interface is overly complicated. Additionally, the desktop version does not sync with the app, so I can't see my goals on my phone. It reminds me of QuickBooks‚Äîalso overcomplicated and not intuitive at all. I suppose this product is designed for large companies with big teams, not for personal use.

author: Bully Maguire
text: I think this app is good, but I have found a problem while running this app. When I wanted to edit descriptions or docs, the loading was too long. It's a massive problem because I cannot input my progress easily. I will edit my review after the problem is solved. thanks

author: Abraham Brookes
text: app doesn't work on my phone it just sits there loading the home page. on the spaces page it says create a new space and I do and it doesn't show on the list, just keeps saying create a new space, I add a list and it doesn't show anywhere, I know clickup is a good platform, have used it before so I assume there is something out of the ordinary here however the app is actually not usable on my phone

author: Amitabh Sharma
text: I am not able to explore anything because of the following issues 1. After logging in the app just keeps on loading the welcome page. 2. Even after downloading the app version it continuously loads the web app version and asks to log in again.

author: Rockridge
text: I shared a space and it worked. I refreshed the page on the second account and it disappeared. I attempted to share it again and it doesn't show for the second account. I checked all privacy settings and permissions as per the chat bot. It still doesn't show the space on the second account.

author: Ben Holland
text: I quite like clickup, and the app has come a long way since the relaunch, but it's still very much just "ok". The app does a good job of packing in a ton of featues, but the UX hasn't been adapted for the phone well, and it really suffers for it. In particular I find the inability to swipe to dismiss ( or drag in board views ) incredibly frustrating. It doesn't help that the performance isnt very good either. Still better, but how long has it been since launch now?

author: Hasin Ahmed
text: I saw a guy using it in a restaurant, so I came home and installed it. At first glance, it looked like something you‚Äôd have to pay for, but then I realized it‚Äôs a hidden gem. As a student from a third world country who can‚Äôt afford premium apps to manage my tasks, I find it absolutely amazing.

author: Caleb Frow
text: The app has a lot of great functionality. There are quite a few clunky things about it though. The options for notifications are frustratingly scarce. In fact I still can't figure out a way to not receive a notification for every single update someone makes to my team's page. The UI also needs a lot of cleanup.

author: Austin Devore
text: desktop version is amazing. mobile version is absolute dog water of an app. offline mode is anything BUT HELPFUL. horrendous loading times. and no, its not my phone, and the app doesnt need an update. well, it does but for performance issues. thank you in advance for fixing the mobile version

author: J√∫lio C√©sar Tavares Primo
text: the mobile version is still so far from the quality of the web version. i can't set the recur on tasks, simply it doesn't show any option (daily, weekly, monthly,...)

author: Moonrain Stars
text: As someone with ADD, diagnosed at 52, this is the one plataform that is really working for me and helps me to really organize my work and personal life. Very flexible and easy to use. I love the option to create my own columns for tasks and be able to place my own estimated times for each task, create subtasks and create multiple microsteps, as these strategies work best for me to keep on task. Be able to receive notification on my mobile is a game changer to not forget what I need to do!!

author: Sathish Palanisamy
text: Can't use more than one account! User have to logout and login everytime to switch between accounts. They could have easily enabled App Clone features which is supported by the Android itself.

author: Tina Shaw
text: Fresh install of app won't even launch - just hangs at the opening screen and doesn't load, despite reinstalling and clearing data/cache (per their troubleshooting). Can't even launch app to truly review usage.

author: kelvin clark
text: Terrible mobile app experience. Messages take very long to load and reflect in the mobile app. I always have to clear storage and sign in again or wait for a long while before I see new messages reflected in the app.

author: Justin Winger
text: It's pretty, but it railroads you into certain minimal views and it isn't customizable. It's really difficult to use. But it looks good!

author: Omri Levin
text: Easily the best tool I have ever tried, it's vast in features yet not imposing, I keep finding awesome features I was not aware of, I even reported a bug yesterday and the story team immediately responded. this tool leaves the competition way behind. SUPER!

author: Umer Farooq
text: This tool has been incredibly helpful in tracking my progress and managing both my products and time efficiently. I highly recommend it to anyone looking to stay organized and boost productivity.

author: Simi
text: We feel misled by the ClickUp team as they charged extra amounts not mentioned in the bill. The explanations from customer support were unclear and disappointing.

author: Fedor Lystsov
text: Be aware of dishonest practices to increase subscription prices without notice or choice. The price will go up when it's too costly for you to switch.

author: Sanjay Manoj
text: I was hit with unexpected extra charges with no clarity in the invoice at all. Totally unfair and disappointing experience with ClickUp.

author: Shubham Rajdhar
text: Great app but as others have mentioned, needs better state management. Completed tasks are still showing incomplete. Lists take time for loading. Many screens do not have a refresh option.

author: Ashish Upadhyay
text: Doesn't sync my tasks with google calendar. Cannot show my tasks that I created in the app itself in calendar view but has no problem in showing irrelevant events from google calendar. Not to mention the webapp is laggy as hell.

author: Ali Farsani
text: lying about meeting summarizes and auto-generated points. it is basically a text editor with tabs! OneNote does it a million times better for free

author: AMADI FAVOUR
text: It's a wonderful app. However, I'll love to know why the app redirects me to a website in chrome. It's an app but runs on chrome. This is just my issue with it.

author: Edwin Donnelly
text: So difficult to do even basic things. Needs a lot of retirement to be something I could switch to. Decent concept though.

author: OG Xombie
text: I enter my email, click next go to page that ask for the password, enter and then takes me back to the app and the same thing all over again.

author: bijina sasi
text: As a global firm with multiple branches across the Middle East, we initially trusted ClickUp. However, undisclosed charges and poor customer support have left us deeply disappointed.

author: Anu Janardhanan
text: There was no clear invoice provided‚Äîjust an unexpected demand for payment. Their billing process lacks transparency and needs serious improvement.

author: Christina Allen
text: It has potential but there is a rather steep learning curve. I couldn't figure out how to set up a kanban board or anything that would allow me to transfer from Trello. a lot of the site requires a desktop to set up. Make it mobile friendly. it's too clunky and doesn't make any sense. if it takes me more than 5 minutes to figure out, I'm going somewhere else.

author: Darin Beard
text: it's very buggy right now. Sometimes it won't open at all. developer_response_text:

author: Michael
text: The mobile app needs serious fixes. Major issues: Notifications lead to empty pages even after refresh, making it impossible to track team updates. Mobile search doesn't work properly - can't find existing tasks. Desktop version works well but runs slower than expected. Not reliable enough for professional use on mobile. Come on Clickup team you can do it!

author: Sarah E.
text: I looove the tool and the app is handy, but I'm missing a way to choose which list shows first when I open the app, and when I want to edit descriptions of tasks, it loads forever and doesn't open on my android phone. That makes it hard to use. If that's fixed, it's a 5 star game changing app. Thank you, ClickUp.
developer_response_text:
Hey Sarah! Thank you for the feedback!

Please email us at help@clickup.com so we can look into the loading issue you experienced and get the problem fixed. Our Support team is available 24/7 to assist help!

author: Grace Lbng
text: I love how you can integrate Google Calendar with the application (clickup to gcal and gcal to clickup). Unfortunately, many of the app's features are non-functional when offline which is a deal breaker. I personally like to see tasks in spaces and in the calendar regardless of connectivity (in offline mode, it shows "Connection Error"). Additionally, reminders only show when connected to the internet as well, which sucks because I don't have connection all the time. On to the next app, I guess!

author: Patchitrakaar Anupam
text: It's a great app to be on a single page in an organization.

author: Tore Rex
text: 2 stars for not crashing. Probably one of the the most confusing project management tools I've tried. Things are very hard to find. Tasks dissappear once finished. Chats gone. Chat messages not showing up in notifications in the app. No push notifications. To get messages turn email notifications. Once you get the email, tap it and most of the times you end up in the vicinity of the message. You still have to find the actual message in the app. I'll stick to Trello and Slack
developer_response_text: Hey, Tore! Thank you for the review! The ability to filter for archived tasks is planned to be added this month!üöÄBe sure to checkout our mobile roadmap for more information. Next, for your issue with notifications. We would love to troubleshoot this for you! Would you mind sending an email to bugs@clickup.com? That way we can investigate this!

author: Andrei Gramakov
text: The app is buggy. Sometimes cannot update the description, sometimes cannot see some control elements. What is more important, the app is narrowing the functionality of the ClickUp service. The service is awesome, the app does not provide the ability to work with it. No dependencies (cannot find), no documents from the sidebar, no commands from the chat and so on. I hope the company will focus on it some time soon.
developer_response_text:
Hey Andrei! Thank you for the feedback!

We're definitely working on improving the mobile app & eventually it'll have near feature parity as our web app. In the meantime, please email us at help@clickup.com so we can investigate and find a resolution for the the buggy issues you experienced. We're available 24/7 to help!
